intro: Teucrium teucriiflorum, commonly known as blue germander, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often aromatic and have a slightly minty scent, which is typical of the Lamiaceae family. Teucrium teucriiflorum is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
